wikipedia_page.main: Alexander James Robert Kevin Penny (born 16 February 1997) is a professional footballer who plays as a defender for National League North side Kidderminster Harriers.

link_mentions.page: List of Hamilton Academical F.C. players

response: DCLFC recruited their first "official" junior squads which led to them having U14 and U12 squads competing in Notts Girls League for first time. Both teams enjoyed hugely successful seasons with each achieving the league and cup double. The U14 were jointly managed by Alex Penny & Kristian Speakman who both went on to have careers in the professional game. Steve Hall managed the U12 side which included Precious Hamilton, a player who would go on to represent the club a senior level as well as going on to play WSL football for Notts County.
| 19 July 2017 || CB ||  || Alex Penny || Nuneaton Town || £50,000 ||
| 1 July 2018 || CB ||  || Alex Penny ||  Hamilton Academical || Undisclosed ||

For the first intake in 2017 there were thousands of applicants. In the summer of 2017 the Academy invited 42 applicants to attend a week-long trial in Manchester, from which four players (Danny Newton, Alex Penny, Lamar Reynolds and Blair Turgott) received professional contracts. There were scouts present from 65 professional clubs. It was the subject of a Sky Sports documentary series in September 2017.

Danny Newton was the first graduate who was awarded a professional contract after signing for Stevenage in June 2017. Three further players – Alex Penny, Lamar Reynolds and Blair Turgott – also received professional contracts that summer. Other players from that initial intake also later received professional contracts, including Elliott Durrell, Mikel Miller, and Elton Ngwatala.
